name: Rice
description: India's staple cereal crop grown in flooded fields. Rich in carbohydrates and feeds over half the world's population. Requires abundant water and warm climate.

name: Wheat
description: Second most important cereal crop in India. Grown in northern plains during winter season. Primary source of protein and energy for millions.

name: Maize
description: Versatile cereal crop used for food feed and industrial purposes. Known as corn in many regions. Third most important cereal globally.

name: Barley
description: Ancient cereal crop cultivated for over 10000 years. Used for food brewing and animal feed. Highly tolerant to salinity and drought.

name: Jowar (Sorghum)
description: Drought-resistant cereal crop native to Africa but widely grown in India. Excellent source of protein fiber and antioxidants.

name: Bajra (Pearl Millet)
description: Highly nutritious millet crop extremely drought-tolerant. Rich in iron calcium and protein. Indigenous to Indian subcontinent.

name: Finger Millet
description: Nutritious millet crop known as ragi. Excellent source of calcium and amino acids. Native to Ethiopian highlands but widely grown in India.

name: Foxtail Millet
description: Ancient grain crop with high nutritional value. Gluten-free and rich in protein. One of the oldest cultivated crops in India.

name: Proso Millet
description: Fast-growing millet crop that matures in 60-90 days. Highly drought-tolerant and nutritious. Used for food and fodder.

name: Barnyard Millet
description: Nutritious millet crop with low glycemic index. Excellent substitute for rice. Rich in fiber and minerals.

name: Little Millet
description: Small-seeded nutritious millet crop. High in protein and dietary fiber. Important food security crop in tribal areas.

name: Kodo Millet
description: Hardy millet crop that grows on poor soils. High protein content and good source of antioxidants. Traditional crop of central India.

name: Oats
description: Nutritious cereal crop rich in beta-glucan fiber. Helps reduce cholesterol levels. Increasingly popular health food.

name: Quinoa
description: Complete protein grain crop native to Andes but adapted to Indian conditions. Superfood with all essential amino acids.

name: Amaranth
description: Ancient grain crop with exceptional nutritional value. Complete protein source and gluten-free. Sacred crop in Indian culture.

name: Chickpea (Chana)
description: Most important pulse crop in India. Excellent source of protein and dietary fiber. Forms nitrogen-fixing nodules improving soil fertility.

name: Pigeon Pea (Arhar)
description: Protein-rich pulse crop also known as red gram. Deep-rooted plant that improves soil structure and fertility.

name: Black Gram (Urad)
description: Important pulse crop used to make dal and traditional foods. Rich in protein and minerals. Nitrogen-fixing legume.

name: Green Gram (Moong)
description: Highly digestible pulse crop rich in protein and vitamins. Short duration crop that fits well in cropping systems.

name: Lentil (Masur)
description: Cool season pulse crop rich in protein iron and folate. Important component of vegetarian diet in India.

name: Field Pea
description: Cool season pulse crop grown for both food and fodder. High protein content and nitrogen-fixing ability.

name: Black-eyed Pea
description: Heat-tolerant pulse crop also known as cowpea. Good source of protein and adapts to marginal lands.

name: Cowpea
description: Dual-purpose crop grown for both grain and fodder. Highly nutritious and drought-tolerant legume.

name: Kidney Bean
description: Nutritious pulse crop rich in protein fiber and antioxidants. Popular in northern Indian cuisine.

name: Lima Bean
description: Large-seeded pulse crop with high protein content. Also known as butter bean due to creamy texture.

name: Hyacinth Bean
description: Multipurpose legume grown for pods leaves and tubers. Also known as lablab bean. Common in South Indian cuisine.

name: Horse Gram
description: Hardy pulse crop that grows on poor soils. High protein content and medicinal properties. Traditional crop of South India.

name: Moth Bean
description: Drought-resistant pulse crop adapted to arid regions. Nutritious and used in traditional Rajasthani cuisine.

name: Cluster Bean (Guar)
description: Dual-purpose crop grown for vegetable pods and industrial gum. Source of guar gum used in food industry.

name: Winged Bean
description: Tropical legume with edible pods leaves tubers and seeds. Known as four-angled bean. Highly nutritious superfood.

name: Broad Bean
description: Cool season pulse crop also known as fava bean. Rich in protein folate and dietary fiber.

name: French Bean
description: Popular vegetable crop grown for tender green pods. High in vitamins minerals and antioxidants.

name: Soybean
description: Complete protein oilseed crop with all essential amino acids. Major source of vegetable oil and protein meal.

name: Peanut (Groundnut)
description: Important oilseed crop that fixes atmospheric nitrogen. Rich source of protein healthy fats and vitamins.

name: Velvet Bean
description: Medicinal legume crop used in Ayurveda. Contains L-DOPA compound beneficial for Parkinson's disease treatment.

name: Mustard
description: Important oilseed crop producing pungent oil used in cooking. Seeds used as spice and condiment.

name: Rapeseed
description: Cool season oilseed crop closely related to mustard. Produces oil used for cooking and industrial purposes.

name: Sunflower
description: High-yielding oilseed crop with edible oil and protein-rich cake. Also grown for ornamental purposes.

name: Safflower
description: Drought-tolerant oilseed crop producing oil rich in linoleic acid. Flowers used for natural dye production.

name: Sesame
description: Ancient oilseed crop producing nutrient-rich oil and seeds. Seeds used in confectionery and traditional sweets.

name: Niger
description: Small-seeded oilseed crop producing oil with high vitamin E content. Seeds also used as bird feed.

name: Linseed
description: Oilseed crop producing omega-3 rich oil. Used for industrial purposes and as health supplement.

name: Castor
description: Non-edible oilseed crop producing oil for industrial applications. Used in cosmetics pharmaceuticals and lubricants.

name: Olive
description: Evergreen tree crop producing oil-rich fruits. Source of healthy monounsaturated fats and antioxidants.

name: Coconut
description: Versatile palm tree producing oil water fiber and food. Known as tree of life in tropical regions.

name: Oil Palm
description: High-yielding oil crop producing the most oil per unit area. Major source of palm oil for food and industry.

name: Cotton
description: Major fiber crop producing natural fiber for textile industry. Cottonseed oil used for cooking and industrial purposes.

name: Sugarcane
description: Important sugar crop and raw material for jaggery and ethanol production. Major cash crop in tropical regions.

name: Jute
description: Natural fiber crop producing strong biodegradable fiber. Used for making bags ropes and eco-friendly packaging.

name: Mesta
description: Alternative fiber crop similar to jute. Produces strong fiber used in textile and packaging industries.

name: Tea
description: Evergreen shrub producing leaves for popular beverage. Rich in antioxidants and grown in hilly regions.

name: Coffee
description: Tropical crop producing beans for popular caffeinated beverage. Grown in shade under tree canopy.

name: Turmeric
description: Medicinal spice crop with anti-inflammatory properties. Rhizomes used fresh dried and powdered in cooking.

name: Ginger
description: Aromatic spice crop with medicinal properties. Fresh rhizomes used in cooking and traditional medicine.

name: Chili
description: Pungent spice crop rich in vitamin C and capsaicin. Used fresh dried and powdered in Indian cuisine.

name: Black Pepper
description: King of spices climbing vine producing peppercorns. Used as spice and in traditional medicine.

name: Cardamom
description: Queen of spices producing aromatic pods. High-value spice crop grown in Western Ghats of India.

name: Coriander
description: Aromatic herb producing seeds and leaves used as spice. Essential ingredient in Indian cooking.

name: Cumin
description: Aromatic spice crop producing strongly flavored seeds. Essential spice in Indian Middle Eastern and Mexican cuisines.

name: Fennel
description: Aromatic herb producing sweet anise-flavored seeds. Used as spice mouth freshener and digestive aid.

name: Fenugreek
description: Dual-purpose crop producing seeds and leaves. Seeds used as spice and leaves as leafy vegetable.

name: Garlic
description: Pungent bulb crop with medicinal properties. Essential flavoring agent in cuisines worldwide.

name: Onion
description: Important bulb crop used as vegetable and flavoring agent. Rich in antioxidants and has antimicrobial properties.

name: Clove
description: Aromatic spice producing flower buds with strong flavor. Used in cooking traditional medicine and aromatherapy.

name: Nutmeg
description: Tropical spice tree producing aromatic seeds. Used in sweet and savory dishes and traditional medicine.

name: Cinnamon
description: Aromatic spice obtained from inner bark of evergreen trees. Used in cooking baking and traditional medicine.

name: Vanilla
description: Climbing orchid producing aromatic pods used as flavoring. Second most expensive spice after saffron.

name: Tomato
description: Popular fruit vegetable rich in lycopene and vitamins. Versatile ingredient used fresh cooked and processed.

name: Potato
description: Important tuber crop and staple food. Rich in carbohydrates potassium and vitamin C.

name: Cabbage
description: Cool season leafy vegetable rich in vitamin C and fiber. Member of brassica family with anti-cancer properties.

name: Cauliflower
description: Cool season vegetable producing white compact heads. Rich in vitamins minerals and antioxidants.

name: Brinjal
description: Popular fruit vegetable also known as eggplant. Rich in fiber antioxidants and has cholesterol-lowering properties.

name: Okra
description: Heat-tolerant vegetable producing edible green pods. Rich in vitamins minerals and mucilage with health benefits.

name: Cucumber
description: Refreshing fruit vegetable with high water content. Low in calories and rich in vitamins and minerals.

name: Bottle Gourd
description: Large fruit vegetable used in Indian cuisine. Low in calories and rich in water and dietary fiber.

name: Bitter Gourd
description: Medicinal vegetable with blood sugar lowering properties. Bitter in taste but highly nutritious.

name: Pumpkin
description: Nutritious winter squash rich in beta-carotene. Used as vegetable and in desserts and baked goods.

name: Watermelon
description: Refreshing summer fruit with high water content. Rich in lycopene vitamins and electrolytes.

name: Muskmelon
description: Sweet aromatic summer fruit rich in vitamin A. Low in calories and high in water content.

name: Carrot
description: Root vegetable rich in beta-carotene and dietary fiber. Important source of vitamin A and antioxidants.

name: Radish
description: Fast-growing root vegetable with pungent flavor. Rich in vitamin C and has digestive properties.

name: Beetroot
description: Sweet root vegetable rich in folate and nitrates. Has blood pressure lowering and performance enhancing effects.

name: Turnip
description: Cool season root vegetable with mild flavor. Both roots and leaves are edible and nutritious.

name: Spinach
description: Nutrient-dense leafy green vegetable rich in iron and vitamins. Popular in cuisines worldwide.

name: Lettuce
description: Cool season leafy green with crisp texture. Low in calories and used fresh in salads and sandwiches.

name: Sweet Potato
description: Nutritious tuber crop rich in beta-carotene and complex carbohydrates. Sweet in taste and highly versatile.

name: Yam
description: Starchy tuber crop with high carbohydrate content. Important food security crop in tropical regions.

name: Mango
description: King of fruits producing sweet aromatic fruits. Rich in vitamin A C and antioxidants. National fruit of India.

name: Banana
description: Popular tropical fruit rich in potassium and vitamins. Fast-growing plant that produces year-round.

name: Papaya
description: Fast-growing fruit tree producing enzyme-rich fruits. Rich in vitamin C and digestive enzymes.

name: Guava
description: Tropical fruit rich in vitamin C and dietary fiber. Both fruit and leaves have medicinal properties.

name: Pomegranate
description: Antioxidant-rich fruit with numerous health benefits. Drought-tolerant crop adapted to arid regions.

name: Custard Apple
description: Sweet tropical fruit with creamy texture. Rich in vitamin C and antioxidants with cooling properties.

name: Jackfruit
description: Largest tree-borne fruit with sweet aromatic flesh. Rich in vitamins minerals and dietary fiber.

name: Litchi
description: Delicious tropical fruit with translucent sweet flesh. Rich in vitamin C and popular dessert fruit.

name: Grapes
description: Popular fruit used fresh dried and for wine production. Rich in antioxidants and natural sugars.

name: Citrus Fruits
description: Group of fruits including orange lemon lime. Rich in vitamin C citric acid and flavonoids.

name: Fig
description: Sweet nutritious fruit with unique texture. Rich in fiber potassium and antioxidants.

name: Date Palm
description: Desert fruit tree producing sweet energy-rich dates. Extremely drought-tolerant and adapted to arid conditions.

name: Tamarind
description: Tropical tree producing tangy pods used as souring agent. Rich in tartaric acid vitamins and minerals.

name: Amla
description: Vitamin C rich fruit with numerous health benefits. Sacred tree in Indian culture used in Ayurvedic medicine.

name: Jamun
description: Purple fruit with anti-diabetic properties. Seeds and bark used in traditional medicine for diabetes management.

name: Bael
description: Sacred fruit tree with medicinal properties. Fruit pulp used for digestive disorders and cooling drinks.

name: Drumstick
description: Multipurpose tree with edible pods leaves and flowers. Highly nutritious and drought-tolerant moringa tree.

name: Curry Leaves
description: Aromatic herb essential in South Indian cuisine. Leaves rich in antioxidants and have medicinal properties.

name: Mint
description: Aromatic herb with cooling properties. Used in beverages cooking and traditional medicine.

name: Basil
description: Sacred herb in Hindu culture with medicinal properties. Used in cooking aromatherapy and traditional medicine.
